author: Hugh McIntyre
title: The Big Winners At This Year's CLIO Awards: Music, And Doing Good
text: [caption id="attachment_490808910" align="" width="640"] NEW YORK, NY - SEPTEMBER 30: Rappers Sandra Denton, Deidre Roper, and Cheryl James of Salt-N-Pepa and director Spike Lee attend the 2015 CLIO Awards at the American Museum of Natural History on September 30, 2015 in New York City. (Photo by Mike Coppola/Getty Images for CITI)[/caption] The 56th annual CLIO Awards—known as the “Oscars of advertising”—took place on Wednesday evening in New York City, and it was clear that as the awards mature, there are now two topics that are becoming increasingly important: music, and advertisements for good.Several years ago, the CLIOs (the organization) began to get more specific with some of their categories, offing awards only for work in the healthcare, sports, and music industries, and now the music potion seems to have been pushed into the spotlight more than any of the other subcategories. Not only were a handful of music-only trophies given out at the several-hour-long ceremony the other evening, but there were performances by the groups Salt N Pepa and alternative act X Ambassadors. Both bands had notable years in advertising thanks to their working with big brands (Geico and Jeep, respectively), and the CLIOs clearly want to highlight how important these partnerships are, especially these days when record sales are disappearing and new revenue streams are needed to make a living.Many of the most poignant moments of the night came from the acceptance speeches and accompanying videos of those campaigns that focused on helping people. Burger King used its Whopper to help eliminate homophobia, a German brand fought the Nazis that have plagued their country for decades, and other brands aimed to bring attention to other important causes, such as female genital mutilation and domestic violence against women. It’s really great to see companies going out of their way to use impressive marketing budgets to not just push product, but to make a difference, and the CLIOs honored a lot of that effort.Here is a list of those campaigns that were awarded “Grand CLIOs”, the biggest prize: Audio - Leica - SoundLab Container (F/Nazca Saatchi & Saatchi, São Paulo) Branded Entertainment - Affordable Care Act - Between Two Ferns with Zach Galifianakis: President Barack Obama (Funny or Die, Los Angeles) Digital - Optus - Clever Buoy (M&C Saatchi, Sydney) Direct - Burger King - Proud Whopper (DAVID, Miami) Engagement/Experiential - ZDK Gesellschaft Demokratische Kultur gGmbH (Nazis against Nazis - Germany's Most Involuntary Charity Walk) (Grabarz & Partner / GGH Lowe, Hamburg) Innovative - ZDK Gesellschaft Demokratische Kultur gGmbH (Nazis against Nazis - Germany's Most Involuntary Charity Walk) (Grabarz & Partner / GGH Lowe, Hamburg) Integrated Campaign - Vodafone - "Between Us" (Y&R [entity display="Team" type="organization" subtype="company" active="true" key="team" ticker="TISI" exchange="NASDAQ" natural_id="fred/company/9653"]Team[/entity] Red Istanbul, Istanbul) Out Of Home - Apple - World Gallery © TBWA/Media Arts Lab, Los Angeles) Print - 28 Too Many - It Happens Here © (Ogilvy & Mather, London) Public Relations - Optus - Clever Buoy (Fuel Communications, Sydney) Social Media - Domino's - Emoji Ordering (CP+B, Boulder) CLIO Music - Partnerships/Collaborations - Spotify / Uber - Your Ride. Your Music. (Spotify / Uber, Stockholm / San Francisco) CLIO Music - Use of Music - Beats By Dr. Dre - The Game Before the Game (R/GA, New York)Also, these two memorable campaigns were inducted into the CLIO Hall of Fame: Hall of Fame Film - EPURON / German Ministry for the Environment - Power of Wind (INTER+-POL, Hamburg) Hall of Fame Out of Home - T-Mobile - Dance (Saatchi & Saatchi, London)Beyond these winners, there were hundreds of other entries that took home gold, silver or bronze statues.
